alert.note: Alert for Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 7:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Colleton. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 724 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with heavy rainfall falling over Walterboro. 1 to 2 inches of rain could fall through 9 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low- lying and poor drainage areas. In addition, rapid rises are possible along Ireland Creek. Those adjacent to the creek should remain alert for these rises. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Colleton Medical Center and Lowcountry Regional Airport.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
